cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (125 km) south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the north-west Caribbean Sea, expected to cross western Cuba Tuesday and track through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana) late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely near or just west of Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Artemisa and the Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana province
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands (including Little Cayman and Cayman Brac)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Caribbean islands, western Cuba, and the northern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle (including Louisiana)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Thursday night through Friday with a 35 % cumulative probability; low (13 %) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for dangerous surge >3–5 ft along the lower Mississippi River delta and Plaquemines Parish coastline if the cyclone approaches as a hurricane Friday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands Friday–Saturday could exceed 4 inches, producing flash-flooding in low-lying areas and along the river levees.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and large waves in entrance channels; river rise and possible over-topping of temporary levee sections; expected port closure or condition Yankee/Zulu declaration 24–36 h before gale arrival.
